title: Sri Lanka repatriates 41 Indian fishermen
byline: Forty-one Indian fishermen detained by the Sri Lanka Navy have been repatriated by authorities, the Indian mission in Colombo said on Wednesday.

title: Former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa arrested
byline: Former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and his wife have been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over allegations of misusing funds amounting to over Rs. 6.1 million in 2014.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Eastern, Uva and Southern provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Polonnaruwa districts.

title: New wildfire near Los Angeles explodes to 8,000 acres, forces evacuations
byline: A new wildfire that broke out north of Los Angeles on Wednesday rapidly spread to more than 8,000 acres (32 square km), fueled by strong winds and dry brush, forcing mandatory evacuation orders for more than 19,000 people.

title: Suspect arrested over alleged online train tickets racket
byline: Kandy Divisional Crimes Unit has arrested a 37-year-old suspect involved in an alleged major racket involving ‘e-Tickets’ sold for up-country trains including to Ella.

title: PM Harini leads talks on hygiene solutions for schoolgirls
byline: The Minister of Education and Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, held a discussion to address the hygiene issues faced by female students above grade 6 in schools nationwide.

title: Faceoff in India returns over Katchatheevu island issue
byline: BJP President K Annamalai on Wednesday lashed out at the Congress and its ally, the ruling DMK in the state, over the ceding of the Katchatheevu islet to Sri Lanka in the 1970s, questioning the TNCC chief over his recent statement that the move was a “strategic maneuver” by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

title: Doorbell camera catches rare footage of meteorite striking home’s front walkway
byline: It was a simple, sunny afternoon on Canada’s Prince Edward Island as Joe Velaidum and his partner, Laura Kelly, set off to walk their dog. Noticing a stray leash lying in the yard, Velaidum briefly stopped to pick it up before setting off on a quick walk.

title: Breathless on stairs?: Could be warning signs of this chronic disease
byline: Respiratory specialist Dr. Samanmalee Dalpadathu has revealed that 10% of Sri Lankans over the age of 40 suffer from Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), a condition often caused by smoking, prolonged exposure to air pollution, or untreated asthma.

title: Hundreds to get married today as Thailand’s same sex marriage law comes into effect
byline: Hundreds of same-sex couples are set to tie the knot on Thursday as Thailand officially becomes the first Southeast Asian nation to recognise marriage equality. The landmark legislation, passed last year and now coming into effect, represents a monumental victory for the LGBTQ+ community after over a decade of relentless advocacy.

title: Labour Officer arrested while soliciting bribe
byline: A Labour Officer from the Colombo West District Secretariat of the Department of Labour has been arrested on charges of demanding and accepting a bribe of Rs. 250,000.

title: 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Exam results will be released soon: PM
byline: Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education and Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says that the results of the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination will be released as soon as possible.

title: Govt limits support staff for Ministers and Deputy Ministers
byline: The incumbent government has introduced a cap on the number of support staff for ministers and deputy ministers.

title: Online train tickets racket: Two more arrested including railway technical officer
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested two more suspects including an employee of the Department of Railways in connection with an alleged major racket involving the resale of ‘e-Tickets’ for up-country train journeys, including those to Ella.

title: Traffic disruptions expected on Colombo–Kandy main road tomorrow
byline: Police have issued a traffic advisory in anticipation of road blockages during the annual “Duruthu Nada” Maha Perahera, which will take place tomorrow (January 24) in the Nittambuwa area on the Colombo – Kandy main road.

title: Former Minister Anura Yapa and wife produced before court
byline: Former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and his wife, who were arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over allegations of misusing funds amounting to over Rs. 6.1 million in 2014, have been presented before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: MP Archchuna ‘frustrated’, withdraws support for ruling party
byline: Jaffna District Independent MP Dr. Ramanathan Archchuna declared today (23) in Parliament that he will no longer support the ruling party, citing a violation of his parliamentary privileges.

title: Rail accident kills 12 in western India after passengers jump onto tracks over fire alert
byline: At least 12 train passengers were killed in western India Wednesday after being struck by another train on an adjacent track after they jumped from their coaches in panic to escape a rumored fire incident, the Press Trust of India reported.

title: ASPI exceeds 17,000 for first time ever
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached a historic milestone today (January 23) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 17,000-points mark for the first time in the capital market’s history.

title: Opposition MP accuses ministers of misusing high-end govt vehicles
byline: Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake alleges that several government ministers, misuse government vehicles despite official claims that no such vehicles have been provided to them.

title: Over 3,600 dengue cases, 2 deaths reported in first three weeks of 2025
byline: The National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU) says that 3,649 dengue cases have been reported in the country within the first three weeks of this year.

title: Former Minister Anura Yapa and wife granted bail
byline: Former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and his wife, who were arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over allegations of misusing funds amounting to over Rs. 6.1 million in 2014, have been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Urgent, one-day and normal service: Minister clarifies current options for obtaining passports
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala clarified in Parliament today (23) the process of obtaining a passport under the new online method through one-day service.

title: 2012 Greek bonds case against Cabraal moved to February
byline: The Colombo High Court has moved to February 21 to deliver its decision pertaining to the reply submissions by the Bribery Commission in relation to the case filed against former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal and a group of defendants.

title: Suspect arrested with over 11kg ‘Ice’ and heroin in Malabe
byline: A suspect has been arrested along with 11 kilograms and 02 grams of ‘Ice’ (Crystal Methamphetamine) and 180 grams of heroin during a raid carried out at a residence on Kahanthota Road in Malabe.

title: Parliament increases daily meal charges for MPs
byline: The House Committee of Parliament has decided to raise the daily meals charges for Members of Parliament to Rs. 2,000.

title: ASPI hits new all-time high as market continues upward trend
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange has increased by 197.19 points (1.17%) to close at 17,025.99 points today, reaching a new all-time high.

title: Star TV host retires as sex scandal rocks Japan industry
byline: Japanese TV host Masahiro Nakai, one of the country’s most recognisable faces on television, has announced that he is retiring after a sexual assault allegation that has rocked the country’s entertainment industry.

title: Meta denies forcing users to follow Trump accounts
byline: Meta, the company which owns social media networks Facebook and Instagram, has denied forcing users to follow official accounts belonging to senior figures in the new Trump administration.

title: CAA raids errant rice traders in Colombo; Island-wide night raids planned
byline: Special investigation teams of the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) have raided several wholesale and retail outlets in Colombo District and detected 20 traders selling rice at prices exceeding the maximum retail price.

title: 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Exam results released
byline: The results of the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination has been released online, the Commissioner General of Examinations announced.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam cut-off marks released
byline: The district-level cut-off marks of the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination 2024 have been released by the Department of Examination.

title: STF raid large-scale illegal distillery; 4,000 liquor bottles seized
byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) has raided a large-scale illegal distillery in the Kiribathgoda area and seized nearly 4,000 bottles of liquor.

title: SLBFE aims for 340,000 foreign employment opportunities in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLFEB) has announced its target of facilitating foreign employment opportunities for a total of 340,000 Sri Lankan citizens within this year.

title: Oscar nominations 2025: full list of nominees for 97th Academy Awards
byline: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced nominations on Thursday for the 97th Oscars.

title: Ireland finally appoints new prime minister after chaos in parliament
byline: Micheál Martin became Ireland’s taoiseach (prime minister) for the second time in his political career on Thursday, a day later than planned.
